title: Pacific Cuban Black Beans and Rice
ingredients: 2  smoked Spanish chorizo sausage links, coarsely chopped
1 teaspoon red wine vinegar, or more to taste
½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste
method: Step 1: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
Step 2: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Sauté onion, bell pepper, carrots, celery, and garlic until tender, about 5 minutes.

Step 3: Add black beans and liquid from can, chorizo, chicken stock, picante sauce, bay leaves, paprika, vinegar, cumin, sugar, salt, black pepper, and red pepper flakes. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until beans are soft, about 30 minutes.
Step 4: Remove cover and continue cooking until mixture reaches desired consistency, about 20 minutes more. Remove bay leaves, adjust seasoning, and serve over rice.
Step 5: To kick up the rice, mix 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, 1/4 cup chopped cilantro, and 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice into the hot cooked rice. Top with beans and serve.
Step 6: Use any smoked sausage in place of chorizo, if desired.
